definition: to believe in (a deity or other supernatural being)/to worship
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)

sentences.english: His worship and religion will endure neither mixture, nor partner.
sentences.chinese: 他的崇奉和宗教便決不容有混雜和伴侶。

sentences.english: In their own innovation, not to harm their worship the same.
sentences.chinese: 於各自創新中，不害其同一崇奉。

sentences.english: Directors believe in the auteur theory but not many actors do.
sentences.chinese: 導演們崇奉導演第一論，不過很多演員不這麼認爲。

sentences.english: Some believed that fish was the totem of Banpo primitives.
sentences.chinese: 有人推測這可能是半坡氏族崇奉的圖騰。

sentences.english: The so-called "worship the same, however, do not harm their own innovation."
sentences.chinese: 所謂“於同一崇奉中，不害其各自創新。

sentences.english: So, this is the entrance to Parthenon that it was a temple to the goddess, Athena.
sentences.chinese: 這是神廟的入口，這座神廟崇奉雅典娜女神。

sentences.english: The Greeks used to worship several gods.
sentences.chinese: 過去，希臘人崇奉幾種神。

sentences.english: Among them, "A Sealed Book Affair" pushed this adoration to the crest.
sentences.chinese: 其中，“天書事件”將對祥瑞的崇奉推向了頂峯。

definition: to worship/to pay respects to (a deity, ancestor etc)/(of a shrine or temple) to be dedicated to (a deity, ancestor etc)
to believe firmly/devout in one's faith
